SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

org.rcsb.mbt.model
Class StructureMap

java.lang.Object
  org.rcsb.mbt.model.StructureMap

public class StructureMap
extends java.lang.Object

After initial loading, the structure is incorporated into a referenceable structure by this class.

To do this, it generates a number of hierarchical links, indexes, and generally provides access to the numerous relationships that exists between chains, fragments (secondary structure conformations), residues, atoms, and bonds for a Structure.

The map then enables one to "walk" a Structure's backbone, and finds "gaps" in the map (ie: segments of chains which are not spanned by Conformation objects). The set of map relationships that are managed by this class are suitable for applications and viewers to construct more spacially/biologically meaningful representations and displays.

SRC="doc-files/StructureMap.jpg"/>

The class provides a number of different "entry points" to traverse the underlying Structure data. The one an application should choose depends mostly on what the application wishes to accomplish. For example, while a basic sequence viewer might simply walk the raw list of residues (ie: by calling getResidueCount and getResidue in a loop) another sequence viewer may want to obtain residues by walking each chain (ie: by calling getChainCount, plus getChain and chain.getResidue in a nested loop) so that it knows where the residues of one chain ends and another begins. Again, its entirely up to the application.

Additional: This is contained in the Structure class. This class also contains the scene node (sub-scene) for the structure. 13-May-08 - rickb

Author:
John L. Moreland, rickb (revisions)
See Also:
StructureComponent, StructureComponentRegistry

fillDisorderedGaps

pdbId

structureStyles

protected StructureStyles structureStyles
Stores a reference to a StructureStyles object for this StructureMap. Only one StructureStyles needs to be created for a given StructureMap, because no inter-method-call state is kept by the object. Once a single StructureStyles is created, subsequent calls to the getStructureStyles method return the same StructureStyles object.

isImmutable

protected boolean isImmutable

getStructure

public Structure getStructure()
Returns the Structure object used to construct this StructureMap.

getAtomCoordinateBounds

public double[][] getAtomCoordinateBounds()
Return the coordinate bounds for a Structure's atom coordinates.

These bounding values are used in several parts of the toolkit including:

  • To compute a default camera view in the StructureViewer.
  • To partition space for bond searching.
  • The structure size, as a statistic, is useful to users.

      coordinateBounds[0][0] = min x
      coordinateBounds[0][1] = min y
      coordinateBounds[0][2] = min z
      coordinateBounds[1][0] = max x
      coordinateBounds[1][1] = max y
      coordinateBounds[1][2] = max z

getAtomCoordinateAverage

public double[] getAtomCoordinateAverage()
Return the coordinate average for a Structure's atom coordinates.

float[0] = x
float[1] = y
float[2] = z

setGenerateBondsByDistance

public void setGenerateBondsByDistance(boolean state)
Sets whether bonds are generated using the simple distance method, or using a dictionary and inter-compound bond heuristics. Callers should then generally make a call to the generateBonds method.

See Also:
getGenerateBondsByDistance( ),

getGenerateBondsByDistance

public boolean getGenerateBondsByDistance()
Gets whether bonds are generated using the simple distance method, or using a dictionary and inter-compound bond heuristics.

See Also:
setGenerateBondsByDistance( boolean state ),

generateBonds

public void generateBonds()
Remove all existing bonds for the structure and generate a new set. Bonds may generated using the simple distance method, or using a dictionary and inter-compound bond heuristics based upon the state set by the setGenerateBondsByDistance method (the default is by distance).

See Also:
setGenerateBondsByDistance( boolean state ),

getParents

public java.util.Vector<java.lang.Object> getParents(java.lang.Object object)
Return the StructureComponent parent objects. Atom->Residue->Fragment->Chain->Structure->null, or, Bond->{Atom,Atom}->null, or null Typing complication - would like to return an array of 'StructureComponent' types, but this can return 'Structure', as well, which does not derive from 'StructureComponent'.

getChildren

public java.util.Vector<?> getChildren(java.lang.Object object)

setImmutable

public void setImmutable()
Meant to clean up memory after the map has been created. Warning: only call this if you do not intend to call further mutator functions for this class. Behavior is undefined, for example, if you attempt to add an atom after calling this function.
